contentList.content: Masters of martial combat who harness Rage to fuel devastating abilities. Warriors excel with both massive two-handed weapons and sword-and-board tactics, adapting to any battle.
A master of two-handed weapons who delivers crushing blows and mortal strikes. Arms Warriors specialize in controlled, powerful attacks that tear through armor and leave enemies bleeding.

A relentless berserker who dual-wields weapons with reckless abandon. Fury Warriors thrive in extended combat, building rage through a flurry of strikes and entering an enraged state of unstoppable fury.

An indomitable defender who uses shield and heavy armor to protect allies. Protection Warriors generate rage through absorbing and blocking attacks, becoming an immovable wall between their party and danger.
The warrior's burning fury, fueling their most powerful abilities. Maximum 100 Rage.
Random single target damage proc from most rotational abilities. The increased chance is multiplicative (25 * 1.3 = 32.5% chance), rather than additive.
Allows Thunder Clap to effectively replace Whirlwind within the rotation.
Thunder Blast charges are only granted by natural casts of Avatar, not including procs from Berserker or Titan's Torment.
Whirlwind generates 1 Rage per target hit
Frequent random single target damage proc that inflicts the much more important Marked for Execution debuff.
Grants cooldown reduction and applies a debuff that increases all damage dealt, including that of the Demolish that applies it.
Frequent random single target damage proc that inflicts the much more important Marked for Execution debuff.
increases Arms rage generation from critical strikes.
passive bonus which allows dual wielding two-handed weapons.
This is your Mastery. It reduces the damage taken from auto-attacks you block. It also increases your Attack Power. Its okay.
passive bonus which scales damage with Mastery.
passive boost to rage generation with bonus on kill effects.
A very simple Crit to Parry conversion.
greatly increases the speed of Fury gameplay.
large damage increase without increasing the speed of Fury gameplay.
Stacking buff that grants 10% Shield Slam damage and 5% Block Value per stack. Extremely easy to maintain 2-3 stacks, which provides incredible value for a single point. Absolutely mandatory talent.
Basic Armor increase, has synergy with other talents to increase Strength.
Newly added in The War Within, reduces magic dmg taken while in Defensive Stance, not overly useful for most situations. Niche application in Mythic Plus, more useful in Raid.
Excellent rotation-smoothing talent, must-have talent. DO NOT TRY TO SKIP THIS.
provides minor rage generation against a single target, but ramps greatly against multiple.
minor amount of passive healing which ramps against multiple targets.
heals on any parry, not just when Die by the Sword is active.
Excellent single-target damage proc, adds up to quite a bit of damage throughout a raid fight.
single target damage enhancement, which also allows the abilities to stack Collateral Damage. The auto-cast Slam does not cost rage.
very small but worthwhile damage increase.
useful leveling talent, but not very useful anywhere else.
situationally useful in PvP, but otherwise much worse than Warpaint.
notable damage increase, though only while Enraged.
Critical rotational functionality. Absolutely mandatory talent. Not just for pathing reasons.
Provides an extra attack action during combat, allowing for additional offensive capabilities.
only useful for Mountain Thane in multitarget.
calculates the total rage spent on an ability and converts it into a chance to reset the cooldown on Overpower.
increases the extra critical hit damage inflicted by crits, meaning it's closer to a 5% damage bonus than 10%.
removes the 19% dual wield miss penalty from auto-attacks, although they can still be parried.
critical talent which enables Raging Blow resets.
Basically auto-attack rage generation by 2 and performs very well.
Excellent DPS increase applied passively by
This grants ~8% Leech whenever Ignore Pain is active. It's a decent boost to self-sustain, especially since the dmg from
Reduces most defensive cooldowns by a very minor amount.
highly situational due to its long cooldown.
eases the burdens of rage management.
greatly increases the usefulness of Shockwave when using it regularly against groups.
synergizes with Armored to the Teeth to provide additional damage.
increases rage generation during the Execute phase to fuel its higher costs.
an indispensable talent, creating more frequent increased damage windows.
a very underwhelming talent with its own negative bonus in addition to strong competition in Anger Management.
allows more casts of Mortal Strike and Cleave.
gains a stack for each single target attack cleaved by Sweeping Strikes, which includes the free Slam cast by Fervor of Battle, creating great synergy between them.
Minded Fury- increase the effectiveness of dual wielding one-handed weapons, but not by enough to make them competitive with two-handed weapons.
inflicts a powerful bleed, which can be applied to multiple targets via Whirlwind.
promotes Bloodthirst playstyles by greatly increasing its damage during the execute phase.
semi-passive haste buff, with the downside of easily falling off when regularly switching targets.
very important reset mechanic for Raging Blow builds.
provides a significant damage boost for Rampage and greatly emphasizes Raging Blow's role in the rotation.
provides a significant damage boost when using Execute regularly.
enables Fury's ability to cleave single target attacks onto other targets, forming the basis of its multitarget rotation.
Increases Rage Generation while Last Stand is active. Has rarely seen play.
Reduces the cooldown of Last Stand to 2 minutes and grants Shield Block. Can find a niche application if the lower cooldown is beneficial.
Good cooldown reduction for demoralizing Shout that synergizes with other talents in the tree. Good talent in AoE, very mediocre in single target.
Excellent single-target damage proc, adds up to quite a bit of damage throughout a raid fight.

Increases Rage Generation of Shield Slam by 2, which is also multiplied by Violent Outburst. But more importantly, it increases Shield Block duration by 1 second every time you press Shield Slam, resulting in pretty much infinite Shield Block uptime. Mandatory pick for low haste levels early in an expansion.
Increases Shield Slam damage and causes the hit enemy to deal less damage to you.
Increases Spell Reflection magic damage reduction and grants you 2% passive AoE damage reduction.
Simple defensive aura, reduces your damage taken, increases your Stamina and Armor.
very minor with Whirlwind, but highly effective for Mountain Thane.
rather underwhelming due to only affecting the target which is interrupted, rather than increasing all damage dealt, though the reduced cooldown can be nice.
general bleed damage increase, which synergizes well with other bleed talents found throughout the tree.
a single/two target power increase for Overpower.
has the same duration of Colossus Smash, with good benefit against both single and multiple targets.
stacks up a powerful strength buff, effectively extending the increased damage window created by Colossus Smash.
a single target alternative to Warbreaker, which also extends the duration of In for the Kill and Test of Might.
allows more frequent use of Execute.
creates strong synergy between Raging Blow and Bloodthirst, though it resets after any critical strike from Bloodthirst.
a moderate damage and reset chance increase for Raging Blow.
reduces the amount of Whirlwind casts needed to maintain multitarget cleave.
Passive damage output whenever you block an attack, recently buffed, however, still not a popular or strong choice.
Incredible defensive bonus, simply grants 33% more Shield Block uptime. Massive increase to Protection Warriors ability to survive damage in any situation.
Simple increase of Defensive Stance damage reduction. Required for pathing.
Simple increase of Execute damage. Great in combination with other Execute talents.
a minor increase to Execute, smaller than it may seem.
deceptively powerful due to the already high frequency of auto-attacks.
near indispensable damage increase that helps gear scaling over the course of an expansion.
a minor Mastery increase, with the much more important effect of doubling the chance to trigger Tactician.
a minor Versatility increase, which also reduces the cooldown of Die by the Sword.
a minor Critical Strike increase, with a very impactful rage refund for Execute, which is also additive with Improved Execute for a combined 30% refund.
minor mastery buff, with a very important Enrage extension, which helps keep Bloodthirst active in the rotation.
a minor haste buff, with a small rage generation increase which adds up significantly over the course of a dungeon or encounter.
Grants a 2nd charge of Shield Wall and significantly reduces the base cooldown.
Reduces the cooldown of Shield Wall whenever you cast Shield Slam.
Amazing Talent, offers huge amounts of damage output and Armor for just 1 Talent point, not mandatory for pathing but heavily encouraged to pick up!
Outstanding defensive bonus. Greatly reduces damage taken from blockable hits and is crucial for pathing to the Talents that enable the "Rage Feedback Machine" further.
A significant increase in Health and 2% Haste gain makes this talent one of the most attractive talents on our talent tree.
creates an entertaining gameplay loop of Mortal Strike refreshing Overpower via Tactician and Overpower refreshing Mortal Strike via Battlelord.
a very important bleed damage increase, which reduces the amount of maintenance required to maintain the debuffs and synergizes very well with Skullsplitter and Thunderous Roar/Words.
a moderate damage increase for Arms' most important rotational abilities.
provides a large ramping damage increase, though not well suited for short encounters and susceptible to dropping during downtime.
causes Bloodthirst and Raging Blow to be replaced by stronger versions - Bloodbath and Crushing Blow, creating a powerful gameplay loop.
Turns Demoralizing Shout into a good offensive cooldown and Rage generation tool. Grants 30 rage and synergizes very nicely with
Extremely valuable defensive talent. Substantially increases tankiness and grants a steady trickle of self-healing. Mandatory if you want to call yourself a tank.
Excellent Rage generation increase, one of the vital pillarstones to the "Rage Feedback Machine" to deal huge amounts of damage and be an absolute brick house of a tank.
Allows Execute to strike 2 additional targets for a reduced amount. Great for raiding and overall damage output!
keeps Thunderous Roar aligned with Avatar and other cooldowns, provides a noticeable overall damage increase, especially in multitarget.
increases the damage of all bleeds only while Thunderous Roar is active, creating powerful burst windows that synergize well with Odyn's Fury.
highly effective and extends the duration of their normal counterparts.
very strong AoE damage increase, which synergizes with other additional effects from Odyn's Fury.
a minor overall damage increase, though the extra rage generation is largely irrelevant.
a short but powerful damage window, which now activates on the target instead of requiring the player to stand within a specific location.

provides increased damage during Execute, while keeping the abilities used before Execute relevant. It cannot critically strike and does not benefit from class buffs such as Colossus Smash or Avatar, but it can be buffed by primary stat increases like Test of Might or potions.
provides a significant damage increase for Bladestorm and can be chained from pack to pack, but the timing does not work cleanly with all of Bladestorm's other follow-on talents.
a significant single/two target damage increase while using Bladestorm or Ravager, highly effective in combination with other effects that synergize with Mortal Strike.
a major damage increase for Cleave or Whirlwind, creating strong AoE damage windows.
provides great value to Mortal Strike, keeping the ability relevant during Execute.
greatly increases the value of Onslaught, both in jumpstarting the rotation and increasing the damage of Rampage.
gives Ravager a second charge, which is fairly important in most content.
randomly triggers Recklessness, though its low proc chance leaves it generally uncompetitive.
generally uncompetitive, due to its small impact on overall uptime.
triggers a large auto-attack buff, which provides a bonus to Odyn's Fury's single target value.
a minor damage buff, but jumpstarts the AoE rotation by auto-applying important buffs, with even greater synergy in combination with Titan's

Decent offensive cooldown and Rage generation tool. It is not great on its own, but it is good with the talent synergy below. Grants 20 rage. It deals slightly more single-target damage than Ravager, but less AoE damage.

Reactive defensive cooldown that provides a ton of damage reduction and increased healing taken. The 3-minute cooldown is long. After FINALLY being fixed in 10.2.7, this Talent is properly useful for new players and may have niche applications in high keys as a planned defensive. Great tool to recover from a mistake or generally when in trouble.
This talent randomly sends out more frequent and shorter versions of Ravager.
Allows Lightning Strikes to hit multiple targets for significantly reduced damage. Does not hit the primary target of the lightning strike's initial target.
General damage increase for Mountain Thane warriors.
Effectively doubles the damage of Demolish when active.
Keep your feet on the Ground
Very strong passive defensive bonus due to the high frequency of Thunder Blast procs.
Variable Overpower damage increase based on combat conditions.
Increases the value of Ignore Pain, though the ability itself is rather small.
Very powerful, giving lightning strikes and rotational abilities much more value.
Random Bloodthirst damage increase triggered by lightning effects.
Further emphasizes using Mortal Strike regularly and getting critical strikes.
General damage/defense, and almost unnoticeable size increase.
One of several critical strike damage boosts for Colossus warriors.
Allows the consumption of Marked for Execution, even without Sudden Death talented, while also making Bladestorm much more powerful. Has strong synergy with Unhinged.
Enhances bleed effects applied by Colossus abilities.
Very minor and largely random, which means it will not always be effective healing.
Significantly boosts the single target value of Thunder Blast. Triggers in addition to the normal random chance for a lightning strike, allowing two for one cast.
General damage increase for Colossus warriors.
Another damage increase tied to Marked for Execution and Sudden Death procs.
Typically desyncs Bladestorm from other major cooldowns, though the increased frequency is worth the tradeoff.
Die by the Sword - Warrior ability
one of the main personal cooldowns that should always be taken.
worth ~5% damage for melee classes and Hunters.
Arms' primary offensive cooldown, which also inflicts Deep Wounds.
Minor defensive cooldown with good talent synergy deeper in the tree. Must-have talent.
Reduces the cooldown of Challenging Shout to 90s and converts it into an AoE taunt/interrupt. Cool concept, decent in Mythic+, and useful on some raid bosses!
Reduces the cooldown of Shield Wall whenever you cast Shield Slam.
easily broken AoE fear which can be used as a pseudo interrupt.
Fury's primary offensive cooldown, greatly increasing rage generation and the frequency of Rampage casts.
Primary defensive skill. Very powerful damage mitigation while active.
Iconic, mandatory defensive cooldown. The ultimate tank defensive cooldown. Take it.
very useful, low cooldown damage reduction.
useful ranged stun on a relatively low cooldown.
A mostly PvP talent, as being unable to dictate which two extra targets can contribute to diminishing returns.
heals on any parry, not just when Die by the Sword is active.
turns Colossus Smash into a multitarget attack, extremely important for effective AoE damage.
